definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: At present, homophonic transliteration has become a fashion in the translation of trademarks.
sentences.chinese: 时下，谐音译在商标翻译中成为一种时髦。

sentences.english: American liquor companies are finding inspiration in the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 时下，美国酒商从经济危机中发现了商机。

sentences.english: Nowadays has brought economic development and cultural prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 时下经济的发展戴来了文化的繁荣。

sentences.english: Today, most people drive cars produced by large auto makers.
sentences.chinese: 时下，绝大多数民众开的车都是由汽车大厂所生产的。

sentences.english: You know nothing! It is the most popular element .
sentences.chinese: 你懂什么？这是时下最流行的元素。

sentences.english: It sprinkled rain late in the afternoon.
Radical feminism is currently the fashionable topic among the chattering classes.
sentences.chinese: 激进的女权主义是时下名嘴阶层热议的话题。

sentences.english: Because there is homophonic , now often confused.
sentences.chinese: 因为两者是谐音，时下往往混淆。

sentences.english: It seems like a lot more women are deciding to have babies much later these days.
sentences.chinese: 时下看起来好像很多女士都倾向于晚育。

sentences.english: and what's going on um, with torture today and it's really fascinating.
sentences.chinese: 还有时下用刑的情况，非常有意思。

sentences.english: But "change" is the mantra of the moment.
sentences.chinese: 但是“改变”已经成为时下的主流口号。

sentences.english: The popular tour of the season is a 11-Day Tour to Europe.
sentences.chinese: 时下热门的旅游线路是欧洲11日游。

sentences.english: Today, the democratic is a ideality which has been accepted by everybody in the world.
sentences.chinese: 而时下，民主作为一种理想，已为世人所普遍接受。

sentences.english: From the evening rain today, cease after the faint moonlight climb trees.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏时下起一场雨，停息之后，有月光淡淡爬上树梢。

sentences.english: Hi Tim euro family "novice" but conceal the difficulties the euro nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 欧元区大家庭喜添“新丁”却难掩时下欧元之困。

sentences.english: Walk into any supermarket today and you'll see a new trend.
sentences.chinese: 走进时下任何一家超市，你会看到一种新风尚。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to be in vogue/to be prevalent
main stream (of a river)/fig. the essential point/main viewpoint of a matter/mainstream (culture etc)
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
in the middle of the road/to be in the way/to hold power/(fig.) to predominate/to be in vogue
(of a contagious disease etc) to spread/to propagate/(of a style of clothing, song etc) popular/fashionable
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
